title: How to Add Music to Your Music Library

steps.title: Insert the audio CD into your computer.
steps.content: Insert the audio CD into your computer. The CD goes logo-side-up in your computer's CD tray. If an autoplay window appears, skip ahead to the "Click the Import option" step.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Open File Explorer .
steps.content: Open File Explorer . Click the folder-shaped icon in the lower-left side of the Start window.

steps.title: Click This PC.
steps.content: Click This PC . It's a computer-shaped icon on the left side of the File Explorer window.

steps.title: Click your disk drive.
steps.content: Click your disk drive. You'll see this grey box with a CD icon beneath the "Devices and drives" heading.

steps.title: Click Manage.
steps.content: Click Manage . This tab is in the upper-left side of the window. Clicking it brings down a toolbar at the top of the page.

steps.title: Click Autoplay.
steps.content: Click Autoplay . It's in the "Media" section of the toolbar.

steps.title: Click the Import option.
steps.content: Click the Import option. Your computer's default audio player will open, and it should begin importing the CD's songs.

steps.title: Follow any on-screen prompts.
steps.content: Follow any on-screen prompts. Depending on your audio player, you may have to confirm that you want to import the CD or select a storage location.

steps.title: Wait for the import to finish.
steps.content: Wait for the import to finish. Once the audio player finishes importing the CD's songs, you can eject the CD; the music will be playable.

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes. Click the iTunes program icon, which resembles a multicolored musical note on a white background. You'll typically find it in the Mac's Dock. It helps to be connected to the Internet while doing this, since otherwise your songs might not import with the correct information (e.g., artist name, song name, track order).

steps.title: Insert the CD into your computer's disk drive.
steps.content: Insert the CD into your computer's disk drive. Most Macs don't have built-in CD drives, so you'll most likely need to buy an external one and plug it into your computer.

steps.title: Click the disk icon.
steps.content: Click the disk icon. You'll find it in the upper-left side of the window.

steps.title: Click Yes when prompted.
steps.content: Click Yes when prompted. Doing so will prompt the CD to begin importing into your iTunes library. You can also click No , uncheck any songs you don't want to import, and then click Import CD .

steps.title: Wait for the songs to finish importing.
steps.content: Wait for the songs to finish importing. Once the import is complete, you can click the blue-and-white "Eject" button in the upper-right side of the page to eject the CD and save your songs.

steps.title: Open Start .
steps.content: Open Start . Click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Type groove into Start.
steps.content: Type groove into Start. This will search your computer for the Groove Music player.

steps.title: Click Groove.
steps.content: Click Groove . It's at the top of the Start window. Doing so opens the Groove window.

steps.title: Click Settings .
steps.content: Click Settings . It's a gear-shaped icon in the bottom-left side of the Groove window. The Settings page will open.

steps.title: Click Choose where we look for music.
steps.content: Click Choose where we look for music . This link is below the "Music on this PC" heading that's near the top of the page.

steps.title: Click +.
steps.content: Click + . It's in the middle of the page. This will open a File Explorer window in which you can select a music folder.

steps.title: Select a folder.
steps.content: Select a folder. Click on a folder that contains music which you want to add to Groove. You'll find the folder on the left side of the File Explorer window.

steps.title: Click Add this folder to Music.
steps.content: Click Add this folder to Music . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . You'll find this in the lower-right side of the Groove page. Doing so will begin uploading your music to Groove. You can't purchase music through Groove, but you can purchase a Groove Music Pass that lets you download music for free. To buy a pass, click Try a Music Pass in the bottom-left corner, click Start trial when prompted, and enter your payment details if prompted to do so.

steps.title: Open iTunes.
steps.content: Open iTunes. Click the iTunes program icon, which resembles a multicolored musical note on a white background. You'll typically find it in the Mac's Dock.

steps.title: Click File.
steps.content: Click File . This menu item is in the upper-left side of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Add File to Library….
steps.content: Click Add File to Library… . You'll find this item in the drop-down menu. Clicking it prompts a Finder window to open.

steps.title: Select a music location.
steps.content: Select a music location. Click a folder that holds the music that you want to add to your computer. You'll find it on the left side of the Finder.

steps.title: Select music to add.
steps.content: Select music to add. Click and drag your mouse across a group of songs that you want to import, or hold ⌘ Command and click each individual song that you want to import.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . It's in the bottom-right corner of the Finder window. This will immediately add the music to your iTunes library.

steps.title: Purchase music through iTunes.
steps.content: Purchase music through iTunes. In addition to adding existing music to your iTunes, you can buy and download music onto your computer through iTunes. To do so: Click the iTunes Store tab. Click the "Search" bar. Type in a song or album name and press ⏎ Return . Click the song or album price. Enter your Apple ID password, then click BUY .

steps.title: Wait for your music to download.
steps.content: Wait for your music to download. Any purchased music will download into your iTunes library, at which point you can transfer it to your iPhone if you like.

steps.title: See if the music is already in your computer's iTunes library.
steps.content: See if the music is already in your computer's iTunes library. If it is, you can add the music from iTunes to your iPhone without having to purchase or download music from your iPhone's iTunes app. If the music isn't already in your computer's library, proceed with this method.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's iTunes Store.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's iTunes Store. Tap the iTunes Store icon, which resembles a white musical note on a purple background. You'll usually find this app on the Home Screen.

steps.title: Tap the Search tab.
steps.content: Tap the Search tab. It's in the lower-right side of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the "Search" bar.
steps.content: Tap the "Search" bar. This is at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Enter a search term.
steps.content: Enter a search term. Type in the name of a song, an album, or an artist, then tap Search on your iPhone's keyboard.

steps.title: Select a filter.
steps.content: Select a filter. Tap Songs or Albums at the top of the page to sort by song or album.

steps.title: Tap the price next to your selected music.
steps.content: Tap the price next to your selected music. For example, if you want to buy an individual song from a well-known artist, you would tap $1.29 to the right of the song.

steps.title: Tap BUY SONG or BUY ALBUM when prompted.
steps.content: Tap BUY SONG or BUY ALBUM when prompted. It's a green button in place of the price button.

steps.title: Enter your Apple ID password.
steps.content: Enter your Apple ID password. Type in the password you use to sign into your Apple ID account. If your iPhone has a Touch ID sensor, you can usually scan your fingerprint instead.

steps.title: Wait for your music to download.
steps.content: Wait for your music to download. Once the music finishes downloading, it will be available in your iPhone's library immediately.
